experience: You and Joe both know Troy Busot, John Kretz, MBA, PMP, CSM, FBI-DHS InfraGard, and 27 others

Regional health care services holding company operating in Arizona. The organization delivers a unique mix of services through a blend of people, process, technology, and principle innovations which improve patient care, as well as corporate business results. In the role of General Manager I provide executive leadership for the entire set of operating functions of the business including: - Strategic business planning - Marketing - Sales - Operations - Finance - Human Resources - Legal affairs - Technology - Public, Partner and Investor relationsjoseph.natoli@caringspiritsaz.comwww.caringspiritsaz.com

I was retained on contract to work directly with the CEO on strategic business planning, as well as to provide the organization with executive leadership for the functions of marketing, finance, operations and technology.jnatoli@ontopcorp.comwww.ontopcorp.com
As part of Intel's Data Center Software Division, I led joint technology development and go to market programs which mixed Intel technology with partner platforms to create new, innovative solutions.
Vice President & GM - Student Services Platform

Led the transformation of the full suite of student and faculty enrollment, scheduling, financial aid, service and support capabilities at Apollo. Managed a staff of senior directors. Operated an organization of many hundreds of product managers, architects, developers, business analysts, systems analysts, quality engineers, and project managers. Led sustaining system activities and new product development.

Led the on-going evolution of one of the largest Internet learning platforms, including sustaining system activities and new product development.Operated an organization of nearly 1,000 software, QA and system engineers worldwide in multiple sites and geographies. Responsible for 6 corporate owned data centers and hybrid cloud deployments with multiple vendors. Managed a budget of over $180 million for hardware, software, personnel and consulting.Led the organization through multiple transformations including: enhanced data center architectures for improved availability, widespread adoption of agile SDLC and engineering best practices, 30% growth in engineering capacity, implementation of world-wide development centers, and implemented sophisticated testing and data center automation capabilities.Provided engineering and operations leadership across 400 enterprise systems (ERPs for HR, Finance, CRM, etc.) and consumer / student Internet applications (including eLearning, Social, Content Management and Mobile platforms). Received the 2011 CIO Innovation Award for the new service-oriented middleware & student platforms.  Received ComputerWorld 2012 Premier IT Leader Award for division leadership.
B.S., Management Information Systems & B.S., Entrepreneurship (Finance & Marketing)

The Entrepreneurship degree at the University of Arizona is graduate program offered to a select few undergraduates.  The focus of the program is to teach the practical application of marketing and finance in building new ventures whether they are new products for existing businesses or an entirely new business.  The key teachings are how to identify, evaluate and build strong business models; as well as to create compelling marketing programs around product features, price, distribution and promotion which yield a sustainable competitive advantage
Caring Spirits of Arizona - Helping Hands

Caring Spirits of Arizona - Helping Hands is a Non-Profit Volunteer and Community Services Organization whose sole focus is to help low-income, disabled adults get access to the resources and services to assist them in their goal to live as independently as possible with some support.http://www.caringspiritsaz.com/helping-hands/

Principal Architect at Molina Healthcare
September 30, 2012, Joe was senior to Paul but didn’t manage directly

Joe is an outstanding executive IT and business leader.  My experience with Joe was a pleasure and I have great respect for his achievements, leadership and organizational vision.  He has a strong balance between understanding business objectives, technologies and process with a keen understanding of technical architecture and platform design.Joe inherited a Product Development organization culture rich in siloed development practices, one that rejected standardized project management and release methodologies, and regularly experienced software rollback ratios over 20%.  Joe’s business, technical and organizational leadership quickly established product roadmaps, agile development methodologies and sustainable platform architectures.  Under his leadership we delivered a huge volume of business features, increased system stability and reduced rollbacks to less than 2%. Joe is a proven senior leader that will add value to any organization.
Paul Jenson

summary: I am an experienced and proven executive leader with broad and deep knowledge of marketing, finance, operations and technology.  I am equally capable at leading small, startup ventures and large-scale established enterprises.  I prefer the dynamics of mid-size, growing companies and fast paced environments.  My primary value proposition to an organization is helping it discover and effectively execute on the best mix of market strategy, technology excellence, and financial prudence which yields both short & long term business results.As the General Manager of Caring Spirits of Arizona, I provide executive leadership for the entire set of operating functions of the business.Prior to this role, I worked as a computer technologist in various leadership positions for over 20-years.  I built & managed technology systems and related business solutions for various industries including: healthcare, education, telecommunications, law enforcement, public defense, supply chain, and entertainment.
name: Joe Natoli
title: General Manager
